append code at the end, just like before.

Fix: be more robust when parsing SVG intrinsic size

SVG can optionally specify intrinsic size using units, and may use
floating-point lengths and prefixed signs.

Fix: recognize SVG documents without XML declaration

SVGs in the wild don’t always include an XML declaration, and as per [1], they
don’t necessarily have to.

[1]: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-prolog-dtd
Add server_info to the publish() call used by the UI. lektor/lektor#569

Take absolute path of self.output_path.

This fixes bug in issue #298 where the command 'lektor server -O <relative_path'
can cause an infinite pruning/build loop. Previously, it was comparing
the absolute watch path to the relative server output_path, causing the
is_interesting to return 'True' when it shouldn't.

Add additional markdown plugin hook

In order to instantiate additional mistune lexers, plugins require
access to the Renderer instance. This commit adds an additional plugin
hook after instantiating the Renderer, but prior to creating the
Markdown processor.

The new hook is of use to plugins like lektor-shortcodes, which seek to
add new lexing rules to the Markdown syntax. Currently, such plugins
have to resort to a workaround, requiring users to pipe Lektor fields
through Jinja filters within HTML templates in order to process the
augmented syntax. By adding an additional plugin hook, Markdown syntax
additions can be processed without changes to Jinja templates.

Merge pull request #350 from aavrug/master

Modified date field type from text to date. This enables the datepicker on date fields.

Make GH Pages branch detection case-insensitive (#342)

Make GH Pages branch detection case-insensitive

GitHub usernames (and org names) are case-insensitive, and for a user
named Foo the user page's URL would be normalized to <foo.github.io>.
This patch mimics this behavior by converting both target_url's host and
path to lowercase before comparing.

Set sqlite isolation level to autocommit (#338)

Python 3.6 no longer implicitly commits an open transaction before
DDL statements, which causes PRAGMA statements to throw an exception.
Setting the isolation_level to None fixes this issue.

add test for thumbnail creation of rotated images

I changed the test.jpg image in the project as follows:
- jpegtran -rotate 270 -copy all test.jpg > out.jpg && mv out.jpg test.jpg
- exiftool -Orientation='Rotate 90 CW' test.jpg && rm test.jpg_original

This means that the generated thumbnails should look exactly the same,
even though the original image is rotated and has an appropriate
header set.

Added quality param for thumbnail generation (#292)

* Added quality param for thumbnail generation

* Added test for image quality

Ignore the cache directory when watching for changes (#306)

Before this commit, if the cache directory was in the project directory
or in a subdirectory of it, `lektor server` rebuilt the project forever.
This commit ignores any event in that directory from the watcher,
preventing this behavior.
Add readme and license to manifest (#309)

Make text_factory for PY2 (#299)

Make sqlite text_factory for Python 2

So that we avoid problems with non-ASCII characters in file names.

Shift cache to local appdata on Windows (#260)

Lektor has been storing its cache in the roaming app data directory
(`%APPDATA%`, typically `C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming` but quite
possibly on a remote machine, either genuinely living on another machine
or uploaded when you log out and synchronised again when you log in).

For Vista and later, this is not appropriate; the local app data directory
(`%LOCALAPPDATA%`, typically `C:\Users\username\AppData\Local` and defined
as not being on a remote machine) is where it should be instead, because
it is machine-specific (for example, two machines may have different
versions of Python, or different architectures).

APPDATA remains as a fallback before ~, because XP won’t have LOCALAPPDATA
set.

Transform admin jsx from Es5 to es6 (#254)

Updated admin JS from ES5 to ES6

Merge pull request #205 from singingwolfboy/ordered-alts

Maintain ordering of alternatives in environment
Add Travis CI badge to README
Update copyright for 2016
If we don't have imagemagick available, skip tests that require it

Maintain ordering of alternatives in environment

The environment file was populating a regular (unordered) Python
dictionary with alternatives, and then the tests were asserting
on the order of these alternatives via the `get_alts()` function.
As a result, these tests were fragile: the order of the list could
change at any time, and if it did, these tests would fail. In fact,
the tests were asserting on an ordering that did not match the ordering
in the .lektorproject file.

With this change, the ordering of the alternatives is maintained
in the environment. The output of the `get_alts()` is consistent, and
can be safely asserted on.

Add support for pagination resolving on root URL.  This fixes #136

Fix siblings dependency tracking.

Introduces virtual path 'record@siblings'.

Introduces the idea of virtual dependency references: a record can now
depend on a virtual source like 'record@siblings'. If that virtual
source's underlying files change, OR if the virtual source points to
different files than it did before, then pages depending on the virtual
source are rebuilt.

Implemented with VirtualSource.get_mtime(), the greatest mod time of the
files this virtual source represents, and VirtualSource.get_checksum(),
like 'file1:checksum1|file2:checksum2', to track all the filenames and
checksums of this virtual source's actual files.

Fixes #114.
